thread.title: Trump To House GOP: Back Health Care Bill Or Face Defeat
thread.title_full: Trump To House GOP: Back Health Care Bill Or Face Defeat

author: Jack Davis
title: Trump To House GOP: Back Health Care Bill Or Face Defeat
text:
Trump To House GOP: Back Health Care Bill Or Face Defeat "... knocked the ball out of the park." by Jack Davis March 21, 2017 at 10:54am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
President Donald Trump urged Republican congressman Tuesday to pass the House bill replacing Obamacare and warned them that if the bill fails, they will pay a political price. 
“We have a chance to do something fantastic , to do something amazing,” Trump told the lawmakers, according to sources in the room who relayed information to Politico. 
“This Thursday we have a chance to repeal and replace Obamacare, and this time you’ve actually got someone who will sign the bill,” Trump told them. “I’m asking for your vote.” Advertisement - story continues below Top EPA Official Unexpectedly Resigns, Citing Rampant Infighting At Agency 
Trump was clear about the price of failure. 
“Many of you came in on the pledge to repeal and replace Obamacare. I honestly think many of you will lose your seats in 2018 if you don’t get this done,” he added. JUST IN: Trump warns GOP in closed-door meeting: Repeal and replace Obamacare or lose your seats https://t.co/zS3cnsM6w3 pic.twitter.com/i5MH8cRap7 
— The Hill (@thehill) March 21, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below 
Trump’s meeting with GOP congressmen, which took place on Capitol Hill, comes two days before Thursday’s scheduled vote on the bill. If the House passes the bill, it will head to the Senate, where its passage is less assured but changes are almost a certainty. 
House Speaker Paul Ryan, R-Wis., cast Trump’s visit to House Republicans as a reminder they made a promise to America’s voters. 
“The president of the United States came to us and said, ‘We made a promise to the American people and we need to keep our promises,'” he said. “The president was very clear and he laid it on the line for us.” 
“Everybody running for Congress in the House, everybody running for Senate, the president himself, said to the American people, ‘You give us this chance, this responsibility, this opportunity with a Republican president, with a Republican Senate, with a Republican House, and we will repeal and replace ObamaCare,’” Ryan said. Advertisement - story continues below
